name: Ayesha Ali
bio: Chef Ayesha has been cooking Indian food for over 12 years. She loves experimenting with new spices and techniques to create unique and flavorful dishes.

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the chicken in yogurt and spices for at least an hour. Then, grill or bake the chicken until cooked through. In a separate pan, cook the onion, ginger, and garlic until softened. Add in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down. Add the cooked chicken to the sauce and simmer for 10-15 minutes. Finish with a swirl of cream.

recipes.name: Chana Masala
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan, and sauté the onion, ginger, and garlic until golden. Add in the spices and cook for a minute or two. Add in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down. Add in the chickpeas, and simmer until the chickpeas are cooked through. Finish with a squeeze of lemon juice.

recipes.name: Saag Paneer
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan, and sauté the onion, ginger, and garlic until golden. Add in the spices and cook for a minute or two. Add in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down. Add in the spinach, and cook until wilted. Add in the cubed paneer and simmer for a few minutes. Finish with a swirl of cream.

name: Rajesh Kumar
bio: Chef Rajesh has been cooking Indian food for over 15 years. He is passionate about preserving traditional Indian cooking techniques and flavors.

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the chicken in yogurt and spices for at least an hour. Then, grill or bake the chicken until cooked through. In a separate pan, cook the onion, ginger, and garlic until softened. Add in the spices and cook for a minute or two. Add in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down. Add the cooked chicken to the sauce and simmer.

recipes.name: Palak Paneer
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan, and sauté the onion, ginger, and garlic until golden. Add in the spices and cook for a minute or two. Add in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down. Add in the spinach, and cook until wilted. Add in the cubed paneer and simmer for a few minutes. Finish with a swirl of cream.

recipes.name: Aloo Gobi
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan, and sauté the onion, ginger, and garlic until golden. Add in the spices and cook for a minute or two. Add in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down. Add in the potatoes and cauliflower, and cook until they are tender. Add salt to taste. Finish with a swirl of cream and butter.

name: Rajeev Kapoor
bio: Chef Rajeev is a highly experienced chef with over 20 years of experience in cooking authentic Indian cuisine. He is passionate about using fresh, locally-sourced ingredients to create delicious and healthy dishes that showcase the diverse flavors and spices of India.

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the chicken in yogurt and spices for at least an hour. Grill or bake the chicken until cooked through. In a separate pan, cook the ginger and garlic until fragrant. Add in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down. Add in the ghee, cream, and remaining spices, and simmer for 10-15 minutes. Add the cooked chicken to the sauce and simmer for a few more minutes. Add in the saffron, mint leaves, and coriander leaves. Finish with a sprinkle of kasuri methi.

recipes.name: Palak Paneer
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan, and sauté the onion, ginger, and garlic until golden. Add in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down. Add in the spinach, and cook until wilted. Transfer the mixture to a blender and blend until smooth. Return the mixture to the pan, and add the spices and cubed paneer. Add in the saffron, mint leaves, and coriander leaves. Simmer for a few minutes. Cook again by covering it 5-6 minutes. Mix all by using a spoon. Finish with a swirl of cream.

recipes.name: Chicken Biryani
recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the chicken in yogurt and spices for at least an hour. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes. Heat ghee in a large pot, and sauté the whole spices until fragrant. Add in the onion, ginger, and garlic, and cook until softened. Add in the chicken and cook until browned. Add in the rice and enough water to cover the rice by about an inch. Add in the saffron, mint leaves, and coriander leaves. Cover and cook until the rice and chicken are cooked through. Serve hot.

bio: Chef Ranvir is a highly experienced chef with over 20 years of experience in cooking authentic Indian cuisine. He is passionate about using fresh, locally-sourced ingredients to create delicious and healthy dishes that showcase the diverse flavors and spices of India.

recipes.cooking_method: Marinate the chicken in yogurt and spices for at least an hour. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes. Heat ghee in a large pot, and sauté the whole spices until fragrant. Add in the onion, ginger, and garlic, and cook until softened. Add in the chicken and cook until browned. Add in the rice and enough water to cover the rice by about an inch. Add in the saffron, mint leaves, and coriander leaves. Cover and cook until the rice and chicken are cooked through. Serve hot.

bio: Chef Ritul has been cooking Indian food for over 15 years. He is passionate about preserving traditional Indian cooking techniques and flavors.

In a separate pan, cook the onion, ginger, and garlic until softened. Add in the spices and cook for a minute or two. Add in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down. Add the cooked chicken to the sauce and simmer for 10-15 minutes. Finish with a swirl of cream and butter.

recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan, and sauté the onion, ginger, and garlic until golden. Add in the spices and cook for a minute or two. Add in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down. Add in the spinach, and cook until wilted. Add in the saffron, mint leaves, and coriander leaves. Add in the cubed paneer and simmer for a few minutes. Finish with a swirl of cream.

recipes.name: Aloo Gobi
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan, and sauté the onion, ginger, and garlic until golden. Add in the spices and cook for a minute or two. Add in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down.Add in the saffron, mint leaves, and coriander leaves.Then add in the potatoes and cauliflower, and cook until they are tender. Add salt to taste. Finish it by cooking 2 minutes.

name: Noman Ali
bio: Chef Noman has been cooking Indian food for over 12 years. She loves experimenting with new spices and techniques to create unique and flavorful dishes.

In a separate pan, cook the onion, ginger, and garlic until softened. Add in the spices and cook for a minute or two. Add in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down. Add the cooked chicken to the sauce and simmer for 10-15 minutes. Finish with a swirl of cream.

recipes.name: Saag Paneer
recipes.cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan, and sauté the onion, ginger, and garlic until golden. Add in the spices and cook for a minute or two. Add in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down.Add in the saffron, mint leaves, and coriander leaves. Add in the spinach, and cook until wilted. Add in the cubed paneer and simmer for a few minutes. Finish with a swirl of cream. Can be surved with steam rice or with bread.
